q: The company announced a bold new direction yesterday by partnering with Microsoft on its mobile strategy to compete with Apple and Google. The problem is it will take years for investors to see results. This partnership won't bear fruit until 2013 and beyond, said Alkesh Shah, an analyst with Evercore Partners. Nokia CEO Stephen Elop and Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer appeared together at a conference yesterday to announce the plan for Windows software to anchor Nokia smartphones. However

David Cameron said he was saddened by the departure, feeling his communications director was being punished twice for the same offence. This is all about the past. It has gone on and on and I can understand why he feels the pressure of that. "I choose to judge him by the work he has done for me, for the government and for the country. He has run the Downing Street press office in a very straightforward professional and competent way. He said he compared Andy Coulson 's regime with "the days of dodgy dossiers, Alastair Campbell , Damian McBride and all that nonsense we had from the past government". embroiled Prime Minister David Cameron 's media chief. Keir Starmer , Director of Public Prosecutions, said the Crown Prosecution Service( CPS) would conduct a "comprehensive assessment" of evidence collected by detectives. The purpose of this assessment is to ascertain whether there is any material which could now form evidence in any future criminal prosecution relating to phone hacking, the CPS said in a statement. David Cameron 's communications chief Andy Coulson quit as News of the World editor in 2007 after one of the paper's reporters was jailed for secretly listening to phone messages of royal

NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell presented the Pete Roselle trophy to him this morning. After accepting it, Aaron Rodgers talked about the journey that led him to the Super Bowl and a Championship win. Finally getting an opportunity and making the most of it, and this was another opportunity last night, they don't come around that often, i just wanted to make the most of it, we did as a team, a great team win, a great group of guys in the locker room, just really excited to be a part of it, said Aaron Rodgers . executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role-- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.
